pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.1.eng: On one occasion when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā upanando sakyaputto sahāyakassa gharaṃ gantvā tassa pajāpatiyā saddhiṃ sayanighare nisajjaṃ kappesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.2.eng: Venerable Upananda the Sakyan went to the house of a friend and sat down with his wife in their bedroom.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.3.pli: Atha kho so puriso yenāyasmā upanando sakyaputto tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ upanandaṃ sakyaputtaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.3.eng: The husband approached Upananda, bowed, and sat down.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.4.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho so puriso pajāpatiṃ etadavoca—“dadehāyyassa bhikkhan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.4.eng: He then said to his wife, “Please give him alms.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.5.pli: Atha kho sā itthī āyasmato upanandassa sakyaputtassa bhikkhaṃ adāsi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.6.pli: Atha kho so puriso āyasmantaṃ upanandaṃ sakyaputtaṃ etadavoca—“gacchatha, bhante, yato ayyassa bhikkhā dinnā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.6.eng: Soon afterwards he said, “Please leave, sir, the alms have been given.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.7.pli: Atha kho sā itthī sallakkhetvā—“pariyuṭṭhito ayaṃ puriso”ti, āyasmantaṃ upanandaṃ sakyaputtaṃ etadavoca—“nisīdatha, bhante, mā agamitthā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.7.eng: But the woman, knowing that her husband was lustful, said, “Please sit, sir, don’t go.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.9.pli: tatiyampi kho so puriso āyasmantaṃ upanandaṃ sakyaputtaṃ etadavoca—“gacchatha, bhante, yato ayyassa bhikkhā dinnā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.9.eng: a third time he repeated his request,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.10.pli: Tatiyampi kho sā itthī āyasmantaṃ upanandaṃ sakyaputtaṃ etadavoca—“nisīdatha, bhante, mā agamitthā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.10.eng: and both times his wife repeated hers.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.11.pli: Atha kho so puriso nikkhamitvā bhikkhū ujjhāpesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.11.eng: He then left the house and complained to the monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.12.pli: “ayaṃ, bhante, ayyo upanando mayhaṃ pajāpatiyā saddhiṃ sayanighare nisinno.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.12.eng: “Venerables, Venerable Upananda is seated with my wife in our bedroom.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.13.pli: So mayā uyyojīyamāno na icchati gantuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.13.eng: When I ask him to leave because we’re busy, he doesn’t want to go.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.15.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.15.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Upananda,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.16.pli: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā upanando sakyaputto sabhojane kule anupakhajja nisajjaṃ kappessatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.16.eng: “How could Venerable Upananda sit down intruding on a lustful couple?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.17.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, upananda, sabhojane kule anupakhajja nisajjaṃ kappesī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.17.eng: “Is it true, Upananda, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.20.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, sabhojane kule anupakhajja nisajjaṃ kappessasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.20.eng: “Foolish man, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.22.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.22.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.23.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu sabhojane kule anupakhajja nisajjaṃ kappeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.23.1.eng: ‘If a monk sits down intruding on a lustful couple, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.1.6.pli: itthī ceva hoti puriso ca, itthī ca puriso ca ubho anikkhantā honti, ubho avītarāgā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.1.6.eng: both a woman and a man are present. The woman and the man have not both left, and both are not without lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.1.10.pli: mahallake ghare piṭṭhasaṅghāṭassa hatthapāsaṃ vijahitvā nisīdati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.1.10.eng: in a large house, if he sits down more than one arm’s reach inside the door frame, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.1.11.pli: Khuddake ghare piṭṭhivaṃsaṃ atikkamitvā nisīdati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.1.11.eng: In a small house, if he sits down beyond the ridge beam, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.1.11.comm: “Ridge beam” renders piṭṭhivaṁsa. Sp 2.280: Piṭṭhivaṁsaṁ atikkamitvāti iminā majjhātikkamaṁ dasseti; “Piṭṭhivaṁsaṁ atikkamitvā: by this going beyond the middle is shown.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.2.1.pli: Sayanighare sayanigharasaññī sabhojane kule anupakhajja nisajjaṃ kappeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.2.1.eng: If it is a bedroom, and he perceives it as such, and he sits down intruding on a lustful couple, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.2.1.comm: “Bedroom” renders sayanighara, literally, “house for sleeping”. Kkh-pṭ: Sayanigharanti sayanīyagharaṁ, vāsagehanti attho, “Bedroom: a house to be slept in. The meaning is a house for living in.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.2.2.pli: Sayanighare vematiko sabhojane kule anupakhajja nisajjaṃ kappeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.2.2.eng: If it is a bedroom, but he is unsure of it, and he sits down intruding on a lustful couple, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.2.3.pli: Sayanighare nasayanigharasaññī sabhojane kule anupakhajja nisajjaṃ kappeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.2.3.eng: If it is a bedroom, but he does not perceive it as such, and he sits down intruding on a lustful couple, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.2.4.eng: If it is not a bedroom, but he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.2.5.eng: If it is not a bedroom, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.2.6.eng: If it is not a bedroom, and he does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.3.2.pli: mahallake ghare piṭṭhasaṅghāṭassa hatthapāsaṃ avijahitvā nisīdati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.3.2.eng: if, in a large house, he sits down, but not more one arm’s reach inside the door frame;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.3.3.eng: if, in a small house, he sits down, but not beyond the ridge beam;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.3.4.eng: if he has a companion monk;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.3.7.eng: if it is not a bedroom;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.3.9.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.3.10.eng: The training rule on lustful, the third, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:0.5.eng: 44. The training rule on private and concealed

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:1.1.eng: On one occasion when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā upanando sakyaputto sahāyakassa gharaṃ gantvā tassa pajāpatiyā saddhiṃ raho paṭicchanne āsane nisajjaṃ kappesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:1.2.eng: Venerable Upananda the Sakyan went to the house of a friend and sat down in private on a concealed seat with his wife.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:1.3.pli: Atha kho so puriso ujjhāyati khiyyati vipāceti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:1.3.eng: The husband complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyo upanando mayhaṃ pajāpatiyā saddhiṃ raho paṭicchanne āsane nisajjaṃ kappessatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:1.4.eng: “How could Venerable Upananda sit down in private on a concealed seat with my wife?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:1.5.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tassa purisassa ujjhāyantassa khiyyantassa vipācentassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:1.5.eng: The monks heard the complaints of that man,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:1.6.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:1.6.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized Upananda,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:1.7.pli: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā upanando sakyaputto mātugāmena saddhiṃ raho paṭicchanne āsane nisajjaṃ kappessatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:1.7.eng: “How could Venerable Upananda sit down in private on a concealed seat with a woman?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:1.8.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, upananda, mātugāmena saddhiṃ raho paṭicchanne āsane nisajjaṃ kappesī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:1.8.eng: “Is it true, Upananda, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:1.11.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, mātugāmena saddhiṃ raho paṭicchanne āsane nisajjaṃ kappessasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:1.11.eng: “Foolish man, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:1.13.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:1.13.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:1.14.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu mātugāmena saddhiṃ raho paṭicchanne āsane nisajjaṃ kappeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:1.14.1.eng: ‘If a monk sits down in private on a concealed seat with a woman, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:2.1.6.pli: manussitthī, na yakkhī na petī na tiracchānagatā, antamaso tadahujātāpi dārikā, pageva mahattarī.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:2.1.6.eng: a female human being, not a female spirit, not a female ghost, not a female animal; even a girl born on that very day, let alone an older one.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:2.1.10.eng: private to the eye and private to the ear.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:2.1.12.pli: na sakkā hoti akkhiṃ vā nikhaṇīyamāne bhamukaṃ vā ukkhipīyamāne sīsaṃ vā ukkhipīyamāne passituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:2.1.12.eng: one is unable to see them winking, raising an eyebrow, or nodding.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:2.1.14.eng: one is unable to hear ordinary speech.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:2.1.16.pli: kuṭṭena vā kavāṭena vā kilañjena vā sāṇipākārena vā rukkhena vā thambhena vā kotthaḷiyā vā, yena kenaci paṭicchannaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:2.1.16.eng: it is concealed by a wall, a screen, a door, a cloth screen, a tree, a pillar, a grain container, or anything else.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:2.1.18.pli: mātugāme nisinne bhikkhu upanisinno vā hoti upanipanno vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:2.1.18.eng: if the monk sits down or lies down next to the seated woman, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:2.1.19.pli: Bhikkhu nisinne mātugāmo upanisinno vā hoti upanipanno vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:2.1.19.eng: If the woman sits down or lies down next to the seated monk, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:2.1.20.pli: Ubho vā nisinnā honti ubho vā nipannā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:2.1.20.eng: If both are seated or both are lying down, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:2.2.1.pli: Mātugāme mātugāmasaññī raho paṭicchanne āsane nisajjaṃ kappeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:2.2.1.eng: If it is a woman, and he perceives her as such, and he sits down in private on a concealed seat with her, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:2.2.2.pli: Mātugāme vematiko raho paṭicchanne āsane nisajjaṃ kappeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:2.2.2.eng: If it is a woman, but he is unsure of it, and he sits down in private on a concealed seat with her, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:2.2.3.pli: Mātugāme amātugāmasaññī raho paṭicchanne āsane nisajjaṃ kappeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:2.2.3.eng: If it is a woman, but he does not perceive her as such, and he sits down in private on a concealed seat with her, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:2.2.4.pli: Yakkhiyā vā petiyā vā paṇḍakena vā tiracchānagatāya vā manussaviggahitthiyā vā saddhiṃ raho paṭicchanne āsane nisajjaṃ kappeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:2.2.4.eng: If he sits down in private on a concealed seat with a female spirit, a female ghost, a paṇḍaka, or a female animal in the form of a woman, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:2.2.4.comm: The Pali reads tiracchānagatāya vā manussaviggahitthiyā vā, but it is not clear what manussaviggahitthiyā would refer to in this context, and so I take this to be an editing mistake. I here follow the PTS reading, tiracchānagatamanussaviggahitthiyā vā, which makes better sense and is consistent with the following rule.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:2.2.5.eng: If it is not a woman, but he perceives them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:2.2.6.eng: If it is not a woman, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:2.2.7.eng: If it is not a woman, and he does not perceive them as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:2.3.2.pli: yo koci viññū puriso dutiyo hoti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:2.3.2.eng: if he has a male companion who understands;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:2.3.3.eng: if he stands and does not sit down;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:2.3.4.eng: if he is not seeking privacy;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:2.3.5.eng: if he sits down preoccupied with something else;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:2.3.5.comm: Sp 5.467: Aññavihitoti aññaṁ cintayamāno, “Aññavihita: thinking of something else.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:2.3.7.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc44:2.3.8.eng: The training rule on private and concealed, the fourth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.1.19.eng: If the woman sits down or lies down next to the seated monk, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.1.20.pli: Ubho vā nisinnā honti ubho vā nipannā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.1.20.eng: If both are seated or both are lying down, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.2.1.pli: Mātugāme mātugāmasaññī eko ekāya raho nisajjaṃ kappeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.2.1.eng: If it is a woman, and he perceives her as such, and he sits down in private alone with her, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.2.2.pli: Mātugāme vematiko eko ekāya raho nisajjaṃ kappeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.2.2.eng: If it is a woman, but he is unsure of it, and he sits down in private alone with her, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.2.3.pli: Mātugāme amātugāmasaññī eko ekāya raho nisajjaṃ kappeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.2.3.eng: If it is a woman, but he does not perceive her as such, and he sits down in private alone with her, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.2.4.pli: Yakkhiyā vā petiyā vā paṇḍakena vā tiracchānagatamanussaviggahitthiyā vā saddhiṃ eko ekāya raho nisajjaṃ kappeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.2.4.eng: If he sits down in private alone with a female spirit, a female ghost, a paṇḍaka, or a female animal in the form of a woman, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.2.5.eng: If it is not a woman, but he perceives them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.2.6.eng: If it is not a woman, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.2.7.eng: If it is not a woman, and he does not perceive them as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.3.2.pli: yo koci viññū puriso dutiyo hoti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.3.2.eng: if he has a male companion who understands;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.3.3.eng: if he stands and does not sit down;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.3.4.eng: if he is not seeking privacy;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.3.5.eng: if he sits down preoccupied with something else;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.3.5.comm: Sp 5.467: Aññavihitoti aññaṁ cintayamāno, “Aññavihita: thinking of something else.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.3.7.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.3.8.eng: The training rule on sitting in private, the fifth, is finished.
